title: How to Add Custom Wii Game Material

steps.headline: Obtain a copy of Super Smash Brothers Brawl.
Insert an SD card in your computer or an external reader.
steps.description: If you have no SD card or SD card reader, get them.

steps.headline: Download the exploit ZIP file from here:
Extract the Smashstack.zip to the SD card.
steps.description: Next, copy boot.elf from the riivolution.zip to the SD card. Then create a riivolution folder on your SD card.

steps.headline: Load up your Wii and start Brawl.
steps.description: If you have any custom Brawl stages, delete them or move them to a different SD card. Out of Stage Builder, insert your SD card that has the exploit on it. Go back to Stage Builder. Riivolution will load. It's a utility for doing exactly what the title says, adding custom Wii game material. Running it off Brawl has virtually no risk, but it will get annoying. You can install it. This could brick your Wii, despite the unlikeliness. That said, neither I nor any developers of these exploits or tools cannot be held accountable if it does happen. So if you feel safe, choose Install. Riivolution will do it's thing, then you can hit Exit.

steps.headline: There are two ways to start.
steps.description: The instructions for creating patches: http://rvlution.net/wiki/Patch_Format. Sample patches for some games: http://rvlution.net/wiki/Patch_Templates. Put your XML files in the riivolution folder on your SD card.

steps.headline: To load patches, put in the game and load Revolution.
steps.description: Enable patches you want, then click Launch.

text: Obtain a copy of Super Smash Brothers Brawl.  Insert an SD card in your computer or an external reader. If you have no SD card or SD card reader, get them. Download the exploit ZIP file from here: NTSC disc JAP disc Download the Riivolution ZIP file.  Extract the Smashstack.zip to the SD card. Next, copy boot.elf from the riivolution.zip to the SD card. Then create a riivolution folder on your SD card. Load up your Wii and start Brawl. If you have any custom Brawl stages, delete them or move them to a different SD card. Out of Stage Builder, insert your SD card that has the exploit on it. Go back to Stage Builder. Riivolution will load. It's a utility for doing exactly what the title says, adding custom Wii game material. Running it off Brawl has virtually no risk, but it will get annoying. You can install it. This could brick your Wii, despite the unlikeliness. That said, neither I nor any developers of these exploits or tools cannot be held accountable if it does happen. So if you feel safe, choose Install. Riivolution will do it's thing, then you can hit Exit. There are two ways to start. The instructions for creating patches: http://rvlution.net/wiki/Patch_Format. Sample patches for some games: http://rvlution.net/wiki/Patch_Templates. Put your XML files in the riivolution folder on your SD card. To load patches, put in the game and load Revolution. Enable patches you want, then click Launch.
